result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles A Shaw was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: Count 3 and any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution of $128.47 to American Express to be paid with prison earnings and to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

AS OF 4/20/2015: Add restitution of $6,850.00 to American Family Insurance as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

Court Costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.

No contact with the victims.
Provide DNA sample if not already done.

superMiscConds.notes:
As of 12/28/2016:   Pursuant to Supreme Court decision in State v Elward, 2015 WI App 51, 363, DNA surcharge is vacated and modified to zero.

Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

Br. 9

Defendant Charles A Shaw in court, in custody, via phonewith attorney John J. Forrestal.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for restitution hearing. State is challenging the ability to pay. Defendant is disputing paying this amount. Defendant is challenging causation. Court presents statements. Court will pass the matter.  Court orders the defense Attorney to contact the defendant via phone at this time to discuss this matter. Case recalled with same appearances by all parties. Defense is not disputing the restitution but they are disputing the ability to pay. Clerk swears the defendant.  Court orders defendant to pay restitution in the amount of $6,850 to American Family Insurance as a Condition of Extended Supervision. Amended Judgment of Conviction to be prepared.
Restitution hearing on April 20, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Charles A Shaw in court, in custody, with attorney John J. Forrestal.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense adresses PSI and medication of Defendant. Parties proceed to sentencing on Cts. 2 and 3. Charles F. made statements. State to file a 2nd information with the corrected date of Conviction as August 3, 2009 on Case 08CF194. Court sets a restitution hearing as to the amount of $5850.00 to American Family Insurance. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 2:
- Total sentence: 9 years (Initial Confinement: 6 years, Extended Supervision: 3 years) consecutive to Ct. 3 and any other sentence
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision 
- Restitution of $128.47 to American Express to be paid with prison earnings and to be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision
- Conditions of  Extended Supervision:  Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  No contact with the Victims.   DNA Sample if not yet provided.

Ct. 3:
- Total sentence: 2 years (Initial Confinement: 1.5 years, Extended Supervision: .5 years) consecutive to Ct. 2 and any other sentence
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision 
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision
- Conditions of  Extended Supervision:  Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  No contact with the Victims.   DNA Sample if not yet provided.
